table_caption: White matter histopathology ratings in three brain regions in six subjects with sporadic CJD with available pathology
table_foot: Subjects are listed based on the time interval between MRI and death. PrPSc deposition, gliosis and vacuolation are reported as % of area involved. For gliosis and PrPSc deposition a rate of involvement was performed (0 = none; 1 = mild; 2 = moderate; 3 = severe). Scores in between two ordinals were graded with ‘0.5’; PrPSc deposition was also described as fine or course. Subjects 5 was the single case considered to have PrPSc in the white matter.* Subject 12, as parietal tissue was not available for all immunohistochemistry, superior temporal was used instead.# Second time point MRI.
